content.description: Stand start with a high left hand sloping hueco and a high right hand two-finger pocket. From there, pull up and match on a great hueco, and continue straight up using an edge and hueco to reach a featured top.
content.protection: A pad or two, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the south section of Cuchesta's west face.

content.description:
Sit start with a pair of edges. From there, make a move out right to a sidepull, slap a left hand onto the diagonal shelf, gain the big sidepull flake, move to the underclings, and continue traversing to the underclings to a walking finish on the ramp.

This is an eliminate. It avoids moving up to the holds along the lip.
content.protection: A few pads will work well. The landing is great throughout.
content.location: It traverses the northwest face of Cuchesta.

content.description: Sit start with a good left hand edge and a small right hand edge. From there, climb straight up through a series of edges and bumps to mantel onto the slab for the finish.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Cuchesta.

content.description: Stand start with a deep left hand edge and a high right hand sidepull. From there, reach the rail and match on it, then use the edges to gain the intermediate shelf, mantel on it, then gain the real lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two or three or four.... The landing is good, but there is a tree and rock behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the center of Cuchesta's east face.

content.description: Sit start matched on the sidepull. From there, gain a pair of underclings above, then traverse right along the underclings to the ramp.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is very good though.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Cuchesta. Shares the same start as Anechoic.

content.description: Sit start matched on the sidepull. From there, work up through a the underclings to the sloping lip, gain a great right hand sidepull-flake, and mantel onto the slab. At that point, you can venture up the dirty remainder or just bail out right or left for the downclimb.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. It has a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Cuchesta.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the sidepull feature. From there, reach a left hand incut edge, bump the right hand up further along the sidepull, gain and match on an edge further left, and continue left and up through the bumps to mantel atop the slab and finish the problem.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is perfect though.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Cuchesta. It starts just to the right of Kava Root.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of incut edges/pockets. From there, gain the big hueco, negotiate the undercling, use an edge, then the lip, and walk onto the ramp.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine. The start of the problem has a rock directly behind it, but it doesn't really play a factor with the climb.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Cuchesta's west face.
